channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [WFLY-2634] Classloading Problem with Apache httpclient
item.description:
I have a Deployment of Type WAR which includes Apache httpclient-4.3.1
which i use to communicate to other web site for Example finance.yahoo.com.
My Deployment includes JAX-RS Rest Services, if i deploy the WAR to JBoss-7.2.0 everything works fine. If i deploy it to Wildfly-8.0.0.Beta1 i got the following error.

10:32:54,545 ERROR [org.jboss.as.ejb3] (ServerService Thread Pool -- 53) javax.ejb.EJBTransactionRolledbackException: Unexpected Error

	... 88 more

After some research i found out that JBoss-7.2.0 and Wildfly-8.0.0.Beta1 both are using httpclient-4.2.1, which are loaded through resteasy from the server modules.
I tried to exclude the server module "org.apache.httpcomponents" with a jboss-deployment-structure.xml but got no success. It seems that something changed with the classloading of the implicit modules in Wildfly

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
The issue is that Resteasy now exports the org.apache.httpcomponents library, so the only way to exclude it is to exclude resteasy.

This was changed in a recent commit by Bill Burke, once I hear back from him on the reason why I will see what can be done to fix it.

Hi Stuarts,

Did you get any comment from Bill ?

Can you please let me know the alternative solution for this.
This was fixed in the linked PR

Thanks Stuart...
Really appreciated for quick response.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. Create WAR with httpclient-4.3.1
    • add Rest Service which calls external Website through httpclient
  2. Deploy to Wildlfy Server
  3. Call RestService
